intro: Synthyris dissecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved synthyris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely dissected leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Synthyris dissecta is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
